title: Scattering2D doesn't work if 2**J == image_size
body:
Hi,

I would like to use Scattering2D with `2**J == img_size` in order to get a (1, K, 1, 1) tensor with K scattering coefficients. However, when I run this script https://gist.github.com/Jonas1312/a0a03c9d3a5307f13ba32348ad8eed5b#file-main-py I get the following error (input image 64x64):

```
  File "D:/Cours/3A/PFE/Python/coefficients_visualization/main.py", line 35, in main
    scattering_coefficients = scattering(src_img_tensor)
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\kymatio\scattering2d\scattering2d.py", line 234, in __call__
    return self.forward(input)
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\kymatio\scattering2d\scattering2d.py", line 187, in forward
    U_r = pad(input)
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\kymatio\scattering2d\backend\backend_torch.py", line 34, in __call__
    out_ = self.padding_module(input)
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\module.py", line 489, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\padding.py", line 172, in forward
    return F.pad(input, self.padding, 'reflect')
  File "C:\Python36\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\functional.py", line 2685, in pad
    ret = torch._C._nn.reflection_pad2d(input, pad)
RuntimeError: invalid argument 4: Padding size should be less than the corresponding input dimension, but got: padding (64, 64) at dimension 3 of input [1 x 1 x 64 x 64] at c:\a\w\1\s\windows\pytorch\aten\src\thcunn\generic/SpatialReflectionPadding.cu:36

Process finished with exit code 1
```

Thanks
